metadata.dc:author: Barriola Echeverría, M
Tovar Larrucea, J A
Angulo Madero, J M
Arana García, J
Eizaguirre Sexmilo, I
metadata.dc:description: We report on two cases of xanthogranulomatous pyelonephritis (XGP) in children. In one patient preoperative diagnosis could be made on the basis of computerized tomography. Although XGP is a pathology diagnosis, new imagine techniques should allow its suspicion in a growing number of cases. This unusual disease should be suspected in from of a IVP showing non-functioning kidney specially when associated with urinary infection and/or lithiasis. Nephrectomy should be performed in all cases.
metadata.dc:title: Pielonefritis xantogranulomatosa: posibilidades de diagnóstico por la imagen.
[Xanthogranulomatous pyelonephritis: possibilities of diagnostic imaging].
